data.title: Top 10 Most Loved Restaurants in Quezon City for July 2024
data.meta_description: Can’t decide on where to eat? Check out the top 10 most loved restaurants in Quezon City for this month!
data.text:
More reasons to smile in QC!

If you’re in Quezon City, the largest city in Metro Manila, then you’re sure to discover a whole bunch of places to order from and eat in! You’ve got options for those who love Pinoy cuisine, Japanese dishes, grilled meats, fancy feasts, cheap eats, and so much more!

Also read: 25 of the Best Gateway Mall 2 Restaurants to Try

With many food hubs such as Maginhawa and Tomas Morato, it can be quite daunting to choose so we’ve decided to round up the top 10 restaurants you should try for this month! Check them out below.

10. La Condessa Cafe + Lounge

La Condessa is a cafe and lounge that offers a wide selection of elevated comfort food. Whether you come here for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, you’ll surely enjoy their dishes, not to mention their gorgeous ambiance. Try the Hamburgesa (Wagyu patty), Estufado (Baby Back Ribs), and Pollo Romesco (Roast Chicken).

View menu on Booky

UG 01 & Mezzanine 01, Timog Ave cor Tomas Morato Ave

9. Paldo

Paldo is a Korean Fine Dining restaurant by Ryan Bang where you can indulge in your favorite Korean dishes in an elegant setting. If you’re there for lunch, order the Kimchi Stew for something hearty, or for a full experience, try the PALDO Appetizer Menu which features six dishes!

View menu on Booky

33 Sct Santiago, Diliman, Quezon City

8. Delgado 112

Delgado 112 is one of Quezon’s cities oldest houses that’s been turned into a restaurant. The vibes here are a perfect blend of classy and homey, especially when paired with the Spanish-Filipino offerings. The Beef Sinigang with Bone Marrow is a hearty choice, but if you’re craving Spanish, try the Tartufo Paella topped with melted Burrata.

View menu on Booky

112 Sct Delgado St, Tomas Morato

7. Talabar

One of QC’s hottest restaurant bars, Talabar offers cocktails and fusion food as well as the freshest oysters, from steamed to grilled, and even in a pancake. We recommend the steak dinner, Rockefeller oysters, chicken inasal bowl, and the kani salad.

View menu on Booky Mo Ignacia Ave, Grandia Place, Diliman, Quezon City

6. Borro

Borro offers mouth-watering comfort food like Baby Back Ribs, Pot Roast Beef with Mashed Potatoes, Creamy Truffle Pasta, and so much more. Its cozy and classy interiors set the mood right for a romantic date or a relaxing night out.

View menu on Booky

Sct Borromeo St cor Sct Tobias St, South Triangle, Quezon City

5. Half Saints

Half Saints is a forward restaurant that offers unique dishes and desserts that feature multicultural flavors fused with classic Filipino dishes. We recommend their chicharron risotto and hummus shakshuka as well as their decadent desserts.

View menu on Booky

The Ignacia Place, 62 Sgt. Esguerra Ave cor. Mother Ignacia Ave, Diliman, Quezon City

4. TABLO Kitchen x Cafe

Tablo Kitchen x Café is a cafe and restaurant that was created to be a place of creativity, community, and comfort food. We recommend trying their Herb Butter Pork Chop, Wild Mushroom & Vegetable Soup, and Chicken Pesto Alfredo!

View them on Booky

14-A Sct Borromeo St, South Triangle, Quezon City

3. Habanero Kitchen Bar

Famous for their Lechon Habanero, 3-Cheese Pizza, and Oyster Sisig, Habanero Kitchen Bar is a casual spot in Cubao Expo specializing in comfort food, particularly elevated Filipino dishes!

View menu on Booky

General Romulo Ave, Cubao Expo

2. Under the Balete

A hidden gem tucked quite literally under the Balete in Quezon City, Under the Balete is the perfect spot for a casual hangout with your date or barkada. This bar and restaurant offers a hearty selection of comfort dishes, coffee, and cocktails, it makes for an ideal escape for a laidback experience!

View menu on Booky

Lot 4 BW West Ave, West Ave, Paltok, Quezon City,

1. Azadore

Behind Azadore’s amazing Spanish-Filipino cuisine is Chef Tatung who runs the home-cooking YouTube account, Simpoli. With large portions and food made for everyone in the family, Azadore is great for special occasions. Try the ribs, chorizo sliders, and the southern-styled spiced chicken.

View menu on Booky

111 Scout Fernandez Street, Sacred Heart, Quezon City
